result.execSummary:
The defendant Douglas J Ferguson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (Forfeiture). This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.
  • Disorderly Conduct - County/Municipality. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Douglas J Ferguson

records.addlTxt: 1:01 PM Defendant Douglas J Ferguson appeared by video.  Attorney Lisa A McDougal appeared by video for Douglas J Ferguson.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin. State moves to amend both counts to and ordinance violation and each would be $5 plus costs. Defendant enters a NC plea by Attorney McDougal. Court amends and orders $5 plus costs with 60 dtp.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
9:05 AM Defendant Douglas J Ferguson appeared by video.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Attorney McDougal hasn't seen the complaint or review it with her client. Attorney McDougal asks for another date. Attorney McDougal request that her client appear by video. Court will allow zoom appearance for the initial set for both DF and Attorney McDougal. Court will not allow zoom appearances after this hearing.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 10, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on May 10, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Attorney Harper appears for the State. Defendant  appears by video. Attorney McDougal appears by video. State asks for an adjournment. Court reset to April 25 at 9 AM

Appearances: CC Schwarze, AK Court Reporter, ADA Forehand for the State, Defendant by video in RCSD Jail with Attorney Erickson by zoom.

Recommendation on bail from the State :
$1,000 cash bond
Attorney Forehand states her reason why she is asking for cash.
No contact with the Ramada or with the victim. 
Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol and shall submit to evidentiary testing of blood, breath or urine, on demand of law enforcement, to monitor compliance. No entry into bars, taverns, or any establishment of which the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol, Phoenix Center included. 

Defense/Defendant comments:
Attorney Erickson asks for a signature bond.
Defendant isn't able to post any amount of cash.

Court Orders:
$750 cash bond

No contact with the Ramada Inn or with the victim. 
Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol and shall submit to evidentiary testing of blood, breath or urine, on demand of law enforcement, to monitor compliance. No entry into bars, taverns, or any establishment of which the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol, Phoenix Center included. 


Next Appearance set for April 11, 2022 at 1 PM
